definition: nature/character/property/quality/attribute/sexuality/sex/gender/suffix forming adjective from verb/suffix forming noun from adjective, corresponding to -ness or -ity/essence/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: Moreover, the judge reduced the punitive award to $480,000.
sentences.chinese: 而且法官還把這筆懲罰性賠償降到了48萬美元。

sentences.english: The criminal policy governing the traditional justice against the criminal offence is retributive and punitive.
sentences.chinese: 支配傳統刑事司法的刑事政策是報應性和懲罰性的。

sentences.english: First section: the history and meaning of punitive damage.
sentences.chinese: 第一章懲罰性賠償的歷史沿革及其含義。

sentences.english: We should establish all-round punitive indemnity system which is suit…
sentences.chinese: 我國應全面建立起符合國情的懲罰性賠償制度。

sentences.english: The third part is Introduce and Reference of the Foreign Experience.
sentences.chinese: 第三部分，懲罰性國家賠償的域外經驗與借鏡。

sentences.english: The law is compensatory ratherthan punitive.
sentences.chinese: 法律是補償性的而非懲罰性的。

sentences.english: Punitive damages is a legal system of Anglo-American law.
sentences.chinese: 懲罰性賠償本系英美法中的一項制度。

sentences.english: Punitive damage system is a characteristic system of England-America Law.
sentences.chinese: 懲罰性損害賠償制度是英美法上特有的法律制度。

sentences.english: When the punitive parent is present, Little Nora cowers away and is difficult to reach.
sentences.chinese: 當懲罰性父母存在時，小諾拉畏縮着，很難觸及。

definition: loss (of sth through natural disaster, theft etc) (law)
to stipulate/to state expressly/to explicitly provide for
to assess one's income and spend accordingly (idiom); to live within one's means/You can only spend what you earn.
